name: MetaTanzanite
description:
check out what I found in the metaverse mines today! A superb MetaTanzanite.

-- The history of tanzanite --

In the 1960s , a severe thunderstorm hit the Merelani Hills in Tanzania , hills close to Africa's highest peak , the famous Kilimanjaro . Frightened, the Maasai nomads who lived there fled.

On their return, they found very shiny blue stones on the ground . They brought the mysterious stones to a local explorer who, unable to identify them, sent them to a gemologist in Arusha in northern Tanzania .

He was also unable to identify them and, in turn, sent them to his father, also a gemologist , who lived in New York .

In the United States , the stones were analyzed at the GIA (Gemological Institute of America, world reference in gemmology) which rendered the following verdict : the stones were a blue variety , hitherto unknown, of zoisite , a gem that does not was until then known only in a brownish color .

Exposed to a temperature of 600 degrees , the stones had taken and kept a blue verging on purple , unique.

A few years later, the owner of Tiffany & Co jewelry , H. Pratt, fell head over heels in love with the Zoisites of Tanzania and renamed them Tanzanites, in homage to their country of origin.

Created by Roman Guillermo // 10.10.2019 // MetaTanzanite // romanguillermo.tez
